messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a world with 16 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, and 7. Room 2 is connected to rooms 1, 3, 4, and 16. Room 3 is connected to rooms 1, 2, 4 and 5. Room 4 is also connected to rooms 1, 2, 3, and 14. Room 5 is connected to rooms 6, 7, 8, and 3. Room 6 is connected to rooms 5, 7, 8, and 12. Room 7 is connected to rooms 1, 8, 6, and 5. Room 8 is also connected to rooms 5, 6, 7, and 10. Room 9 is connected to rooms 10, 11,12, and 15. Room 10 is connected to rooms 9, 11, 8, and 12. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13, 9, 12, and 10. Room 12 is also connected to rooms 9, 10, 11, and 6. Room 13 is connected to rooms 14, 15, 16, and 11. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 13, 15, 16. Room 15 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 16, and 9. Room 16 is also connected to rooms 13, 14, 15, and 2. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 in room 10 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 in room 15. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

Your function is called with two parameters: the starting room and the number of rooms. The number of rooms is always less than 20. Your function should return the path with the maximum reward. If there is more than one path with the maximum reward, return the path that starts with the lowest room number.

Please make sure that your code works correctly for all the test cases. Make sure you do not have any bugs and that you always return the correct answer.

When you are finished with the assignment, please submit your assignment in the assignment submission folder along with a README file that contains the following information:

Before you start coding, we encourage you to run your code against the sample test cases to make sure that you understand the problem correctly. You can find the sample test cases in the folder assignment/input.

Please note that we will be using Python 3.6 for grading, so please make sure your code passes the basic syntax check when you submit.

As mentioned before, you should be using only the standard libraries in your code. In particular, you are not allowed to use any external packages such as numpy, pandas, sklearn, etc.

Please follow the following style guidelines when you write

The door from room 1 to room 7 is locked. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

user: The door from room 1 to room 7 is locked. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

As we mentioned before, your code will be graded using Python 3.6, so you are not allowed to use any external packages.

In this assignment, you are going to implement a neural network for the task of text classification. You will be using a standard feed-forward neural network. You are free to use any neural network library of your choice. However, the code you submit must be written in pure Python. The feed-forward neural network you will be using for this assignment is illustrated below:

In this assignment, you will implement a feed-forward neural network for the task of text classification. You will be using a standard feed-forward neural network. You are free to use any neural network library of your choice. However, the code you submit must be written in pure Python. The feed-forward neural network you will be using for this assignment is illustrated below:
